content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are moderately cautious and may take risks but generally prefer to avoid them. You like to have some degree of security and predictability. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my preference for some degree of security and predictability, I would choose a strategy that ensures a steady income, even if it's not the highest possible payoff per round. In this game, choosing 'B' ensures a minimum payout of 20$ per round. However, since the game has 75 rounds, even though I will lose out on some potential higher payouts by choosing 'B', over the long run, I am likely to earn more than if I chose 'R'. The strategy of 'B' also reduces the risk of earning nothing in a round because my opponent chose 'R'. Therefore, I would choose B{B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

Since I chose 'B' in the first round, my opponent chose 'R', and I received a payout of 40$, I will consider the possible outcomes of choosing either 'R' or 'B' for the second round. If I choose 'R' now and my opponent sticks with 'R', we both get nothing in this round. However, if my opponent chooses 'B' this time, I would receive a payout of 45$. Given that my preference is to avoid unnecessary risks, I would rather take the sure thing (40$) over the possibility of getting nothing or potentially less than 40$ if I choose 'R'. Therefore, I will choose B{B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 20$. Your opponent's payoff is 20$. Please play the next round.
